source.name: Chapter 1.1: Lab 3.1 - effective flow descriptions
source.instructions: **What makes a flow description effective for LLM matching? (Select all that apply)**

answers.answer: It's specific about what the flow does
It includes context about when/why the flow triggers
It's vague enough to match many different user phrasings

source.learningObjectives: SWBAT identify characteristics of effective flow descriptions for LLM matching
source.guidance: Effective flow descriptions for LLM matching should be specific about what the flow does, use action-oriented language (with verbs like "tell", "explain", "provide"), and include context about when or why the flow triggers. Being vague actually makes matching worse, not better, as it fails to clearly communicate the purpose and function of the flow to the LLM.
